cold_snaps.status: No cold snap is happening right now.  There have been 6 such events this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference remains 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwave.status: At present, there is no heatwave.  This year has seen 6 heatwaves; typically, 1.9 heatwaves occur annually.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Today's storm ranked 8th for total rainfall with 13.04mm having fallen, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  8.6mm per hour fell at points during the storm which lasted 7.9 hours.  The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 27.64mm reaching 4.6mm per hour at times.  The event lasted 15.9 hours.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A rapid deluge happened today when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour (ranked top in our records).  The storm lasted 2.0 hours and 7.99mm of precipitation fell during that time.

storm.status: On 23 November 2024, rainfall persisted for 23.2 hours, accumulating 24.56mm at falling at 6.4mm per hour at times.
Weather alert: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since September 03, 2025.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the 4th longest since our records started in August 2024.  There have been 9 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on August 26, 2025.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on July 18, 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (209°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 Oct 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 Oct 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 77.76 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 Oct 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.4 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1665 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 713m and a peak of 1594m, averaging 989.9m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; the temperature will feel pleasantly warm. Also, extremely heavy humidity levels and little or no wind. Light to moderate rain is forecast, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
